Fotogalereya: Lotin Amerikasida O‘liklar kuni nishonlanmoqda

02 Nov 2019, 19:35

Dunyoda bir-biridan g‘alati bayramlar va festivallar ko‘p. Ana shunday festivallardan biri Lotin Amerikasi mamlakatlari va AQShning ispanzabon janubiy shtatlarida o‘tkaziladigan O‘liklar kuni (El Día de Muertos) festivalidir. Bu festival ikki kun – 1–2-noyabr kunlari o‘tkaziladi. Festival tarixi 2500–3000 yilga borib taqaladi deb hisoblanadi.
2003-yilda YuNESKO ushbu bayram-festivalni “Insoniyatning nomoddiy madaniy merosi ro‘yxati”ga kiritgan.
Mavzuga doir: O‘liklar kunini nega quvonch bilan nishonlashadi? “Koko siri” multfilmi haqida
Festival bo‘lib o‘tadigan kunlarda Lotin Amerikasi mamlakatlari va AQShda odamlar inson skeleti tasviri tushirilgan kiyimlarni kiyib, bosh suyagi tasviri tushirilgan niqoblarni taqib yoki yuzlarini bosh suyak tasviriga o‘xshatib bo‘yab olib, katta-katta karnavallarni o‘tkazadi. Har yili Meksika va Lotin Amerikasining yana bir qator mamlakatlariga festivalni tomosha qilish, unda ishtirok etish maqsadida dunyoning turli burchaklaridan millionlab sayyohlar keladi. O‘liklar kuni allaqachon mashhur madaniy fenomenga va turistik brendga aylangan bo‘lib, Lotin Amerikasi mamlakatlariga millionlab dollar pul keltiradi.
“Daryo” bu yilgi festivaldan fotogalereya taqdim etadi.

Blog: Latin America Celebrates Dead Day

02 Nov 2019, 19:35

There are a lot of interesting holidays and festivals around the world. One such festival is the Day of the Dead (El Día de Muertos), which is held in Latin America and the Spanish-speaking southern states of the United States. The festival will be held from November 1 to November 2 It is believed that the festival dates back to 2500-3000.
In 2003, UNESCO included the festival in the "Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity" list.
Topic: Why celebrate the Day of the Dead with joy? About the "Coco Secret" cartoon
On the days of the festival, people in Latin America and the United States wear large skeletons, wear large skulls, or sketch large skulls, with their faces resembling skulls. Every year millions of tourists from around the world come to Mexico and a number of other Latin American countries to see and participate in the festival. The Day of the Dead has already become a popular cultural phenomenon and tourist brand, bringing millions of dollars to Latin American countries.
The River will present a photo gallery from this year's festival.
